comments.body: @liangchenye It seems that there is no test for `ListImages()`, :)

I'm not sure which images are persistent on gci.io/google_containers and suitable for testing.
I'll use images which are referenced in other testing code in k8s.
Why do we expect errors here?

I think that is a part of the removing process.
But you are right, the error is not  necessary.
IMHO, we shouldn't have kubelet implementation details in a conformance test.

I hope so, but I think we don't have a good runtime wrap now.
In /pkg/kubelet/kubelet.go, it simply checks if the runtime is 'docker' or 'rkt' and uses their specific functions like I do now.
My image.go is planed be a simple wrapper, for now, only docker supported.

@liangchenye Just FYI, for setting up rkt as runtime. We will need:
1. systemd must be running on the machine
2. rkt api service be running on the machine
3. pass the endpoint of the rkt api service

Given 1. this probably will not work on container vm, right? @yujuhong @Random-Liu

> In /pkg/kubelet/kubelet.go, it simply checks if the runtime is 'docker' or 'rkt' and uses their specific functions like I do now.

Yes, but I believe conformance tests should be more akin to blackbox tests. Diving into container runtime details and using kubelet library directly seems a bit odd to me. I think it's worth adding a TODO, at the least, if this is a temporary solution.

> @liangchenye Just FYI, for setting up rkt as runtime. We will need:
> 1. systemd must be running on the machine
> 2. rkt api service be running on the machine
> 3. pass the endpoint of the rkt api service

I believe the test harness runs on the same node with kubelet, so this shouldn't be a problem (for now). In the long run, this might not be true though. @pwittrock is the expert.
Agree, once new runtime library is released, the conformance test should be updated.

diffHunk:

	pm := kubepod.NewBasicPodManager(nil)
	dm := dockertools.NewDockerManager(

		nil, nil, nil, pm, nil,
